description: The rogue looks to finish off an injured opponent with a precise, deadly strike that increases in damage the more Health the target is missing.
notes: Ignore the 25% "Bonus Damage" in the ability inspect window, it does not apply.

To clarify the effect description: Finishing Blow always grants a base of +50% (x1.5) bonus damage. If the target's health is above 50%, no additional damage is added to this value. If the target's health is 50% or lower, for each percentage below 50%, Finishing Blow gains an additional +3% damage. Eliminating Blow increases this bonus to +6%. The final multiplier is calculated with: currentHealthRatio = currentHealth / maxHealth diffHealthRatio = 0.5 - currentHealthRatio damageMultiplier = 1.5 + (0.03 * diffHealthRatio * 100)

name: Forbidden Fist (ability)
description: Perform a forbidden technique that projects a part of the soul in a blast of pure force. Those struck are Interrupted and Enfeebled. The damage of this effect is greatly increased if the monk's soul is cursed. After each use the monk's soul will be cursed for a short time, increasing the Wound cost and Damage of Forbidden Fist as well as increasing the duration of any existing curses. Each curse afflicting the monk's soul will continually cause damage.
notes: Each effect in the stack is tracked separately and has its own duration and timer.
For all intents and purposes, only one timer - the latest - is decremented at a time.
When a new effect is added to the stack, the timer on the previous effect is paused.
When the timer reaches zero, the new effect is removed and the timer of the previous effect is resumed where it left off.
How the duration is calculated and applied is a bit strange and in cases inconsistent.
The duration of the new effect being added to the stack in the current cast is calculated with the timer + 6 .
The timer of the previous effect in the stack is paused, and its duration is adjusted to be the timer - 6 (prior to the previous calculation, and not including the first effect).
Negative adjusted durations are treated as absolute (made positive).

All durations are clamped to a maximum value of 12, but keep in mind that this causes the in-game timer to be off by the difference (so if the timer shows > 12, it's likely that it spans over two or more effects in the stack).

This also has a knock-on effect, and in cases where this difference between 12 and the clamped value is less than the adjusted duration of the previous effect, the previous effect will use that duration.
The bonus damage is applied to base damage (i.e. 3 stacks would provide +150% on 14-19 damage, resulting in 35-47.5 damage).
This damage also applies to the curse's self damage-over-time.
The self damage is increased by the damage bonus above, and in addition scales with the Monk's level, adding +1 damage every 3 character levels.

The effects of the curse stack for the current cast are calculated and applied after the ability is cast, but before the damage is applied to the target (and self), meaning the first attack will cost 0 Wounds, but will gain +50% damage.
Forbidden Curse stacks are one of the main ways Forbidden Fist monks can gain Wounds .
From their subclass passive ; when a hostile effect expires on the monk (i.e. a Forbidden Curse stack), they gain one Wound.

name: Draining Whip (Beguiler)
description: Causes the cipher's weapons to generate a field of parasitic energy that lashes out at the target, increasing Damage inflicted and generating Focus for the cipher. (Beguiler) - Soul Whip provides less bonus damage and generates less Focus if the cipher's target is not vulnerable to Sneak Attack. (Draining Whip) - Enhances the draining power of the cipher's Soul Whip, regenerating Focus more quickly.

effects.value: +10% Damage (restored to +20% Damage if attacking Sneak Attack vulnerable target)

effects.condition: per point of weapon damage dealt to enemies
effects.value: 0.5 Focus generated (restored to 0.75 Focus if attacking Sneak Attack vulnerable target)

notes: A target is vulnerable to a Sneak Attack if they are currently Flanked , or are suffering from a Mind or Body Affliction .

The Focus bonus is a little confusing. The base damage-to-focus ratio for a Beguiler is 0.25 (instead of the usual 0.5). Draining Whip applies a +100% modifier (x1.0) to this ratio all the time, and then a further +100% when the target is vulnerable to a Sneak Attack. Both of these modifiers are stacked additively, not multiplicatively (the multipliers are added together before being applied to the base ratio), resulting in 0.25 + (0.25 * (1 + 1)) = 0.75 .
The full bonus should apply if the target has a Mind Affliction , however it currently applies if the target has a Mind Inspiration instead (as of patch 5.0.0.0040 this has not been fixed).

name: Galawain's Favor

notes: This ability is applied to the player character when encountering certain powerful creatures (Jadaferlas the Ancient, Scyorielaphas, Baby Kraken and its tentacles).

It is a consequence of vowing to 'distribute the essence to existing souls in Dyrwood to strengthen them' for Galawain during the 'Council of Stars' quest in Pillars of Eternity, and then following through with that promise in 'Memories of the Ancients'.
The effect is applied only to the first creature of the specified types that is encountered.
Its application is accompanied by a vision of Galawain.
Galawain's Wrath is applied if the player broke their promise instead.

name: Galawain's Wrath

notes: Applies to certain powerful creatures (Jadaferlas the Ancient, Scyorielaphas, Baby Kraken and it's tentacles) if you vowed to "distribute the essence to existing souls in Dyrwood to strengthen them" for Galawain during Council of Stars in Pillars of Eternity, and then broke your promise in Memories of the Ancients.

The effect is applied only to the first creature that is encountered, and will be accompanies with a vision of Galawain: "You swore to glut the survivors on the remains of the dead, but the souls of the Dyrwood groan with hunger." The eyes narrow. Then their focus shifts toward the creature/dragon. "When my champion closes his jaws around you, know that it is my teeth which pierce your hide." Galawain nods toward the sea dragon/beast and eases back into the shadows.
Galawain's Favor is applied if you kept your promise instead.

effects.value: +50% Recovery Time with Battle Axe weapons
10% of Damage Dealt is reapplied per 3.0 sec

notes: Bleed damage is 10% of the damage dealt on any hit (Graze, Hit, or Crit), which is then dealt as Raw damage every 3.0 sec for 60.0 sec.
The damage is stacked cumulatively, meaning each consecutive hit on the target will increase the amount of bleed damage dealt every 3.0 sec.
The duration is not stacked however. Each damage stack retains its own duration and is tracked separately.
When the duration expires, the initial damage is subtracted from the running total. If it was the last stack, the status effect is removed from the target.
The duration (not the tick rate / interval) scales with Intellect , as with all durations.
The tick rate / interval is reset when damage is added to the stack, causing the cumulative bleed damage to be reapplied immediately.
The bleed damage (for all stacks together) is dealt at the start of the interval, meaning the bonus damage will be dealt immediately upon hit.
Assuming that the duration is 60.0 sec, damage will then be dealt 19 more times after (with some tolerance due to the interval being reset on hit).
Critical damage oddly does not seem to affect the total from this.
While it's possible that the damage from this source stacks with itself from consecutive hits to damaged targets, they do not seem to trigger any afflictions.

A Monk that receives Wounds from incoming damage can do well with this Modal to help boost class resources. A Paladin of the Steel Garrote can help offset damage from the Modal itself, but you will typically receive more than you can heal from Weapon damage alone. Temporary health from Spells also delays the effect, but if you do massive damage, then temporary health will not prevent you from inevitably hurting yourself. While Rogue may make an interesting option with this Modal, the Trickster Rogue possibly serves best from its reduced Sneak Attack self-damage, and multi-classing it with Fighter generally helps to provide healing mid-battle and extra base health for offsetting self-damage.

description: Draws upon the druid's natural connection to the boar, temporarily allowing them to assume that form. The boar spiritshift can engage targets, regenerates Health, and inflicts damage over time with its melee attacks.
notes: The in-game description for the damage over time effect shows '0 Raw Damage', but the actual value is 10% of the damage dealt on hit (a hit in this case meaning anything above and including a Graze), which is then dealt as Raw damage every 3.0 sec for 6.0 sec.
The damage over time stacks, but not its duration - each stack retains its own duration and is tracked separately.
The damage over time is dealt at the start of every 3.0 sec, meaning the bonus damage will be dealt immediately upon hit, and then two more times after.
The duration of effects scales with Intellect.
